Class Item

  • java.lang.Object
    • Item
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FoodItem

    public class Item
extends java.lang.Object
    This class overrides the equals() and hashcode() methods so that it wil be properly handled by the various Collection classes. All items have a upc, and all items can be compared for equality. To use certain collection You will inherit from this class. Items are immutable.

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      protected java.lang.String upc 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Item(java.lang.String upc, java.lang.String name)
      Constructs a general purpose item with the given universal product code.

      Returns the name of this item as a String.

      Returns the upc of this item as a String.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object other)
        Returns true if this item and the other object both represent the same item. Note that it is generally necessary to override the hashCode method whenever this method is overridden, so as to maintain the general contract for the hashCode method, which states that equal objects must have equal hash codes.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        true if the items are equal

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Returns a hashCode that is guaranteed to be equal for items that are equal. This method returns the hash code value for the object on which this method is invoked. This method returns the hash code value as an integer and is supported for the benefit of hashing based collection classes such as Hashtable, HashMap, HashSet etc. This method must be overridden in every class that overrides the equals method
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the hash code for this item
